definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: He poured wine personally for the soldiers who returned from the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 他親自爲前線回來的將士斟酒。

sentences.english: The PLA Air Force small test their skills in front of a firm footing.
sentences.chinese: 解放軍空軍小試身手，在前線站穩了腳跟。

sentences.english: Yoda, acting as general, oversaw the battle from the forward command center.
sentences.chinese: 尤達擔任統帥，在前線指揮中心督戰。

sentences.english: He was part of the battalion's planning team, but he hoped to finish the tour as a front-line company commander.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名營級指揮官，但他想要去前線親自指揮作戰。

sentences.english: Only the Kalobaw strategic command refuses to accept BGF.
sentences.chinese: 只有卡洛堡前線司令部拒絕接受改編。

sentences.english: They were set on leaving for the front right away.
sentences.chinese: 他們打定主意立即奔赴前線。

sentences.english: The old woman told him that she had two grandsons at the front.
sentences.chinese: 老太太告訴他說，前線上有她兩個孫子。

sentences.english: Puhakka was active in front service practically all war time.
sentences.chinese: 普哈克在整個戰爭期間都在前線積極戰鬥。

sentences.english: Then, when we arrived to the front line , it turned out to be a Katiusha regiment.
sentences.chinese: 然後，當我們到達前線時，發現這是個“喀秋莎”團。

sentences.english: It has also institutionalized close coordination among government ministries on the front line of disaster relief.
sentences.chinese: 還使各部委在救災前線的密切協作制度化。

sentences.english: In fact, they were all merely fronts for the dark minions and their Anunnaki overlords.
sentences.chinese: 而事實上，他們只是他們的主子阿努奇人前線的爪牙。

sentences.english: They retired to safer positions behind the frontline.
sentences.chinese: 他們撤退到前線後面較安全的陣地。

sentences.english: After the cessation of conflict between the two countries conducted negotiations with the military front-line commanders.
sentences.chinese: 衝突停止後，兩國軍方前線指揮官進行了談判。

sentences.english: They were hurried to the front.
Their troops advanced by both land and water, and arrived at the front in time.
sentences.chinese: 他們的部隊水陸並進，及時抵達前線。

sentences.english: The front features the National Stadium, or Bird's Nest, on the middle-right.
sentences.chinese: 前線的特點，國家體育場，或燕窩，對中層的權利。

definition: to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
